event.title: was founded as a goldmining town after a major goldrush in 1867

data.event: It was founded as a goldmining town after a major goldrush in 1867, and is now an adventure tourist village noted for its extensive limestone caves and caving experiences.

event.title: now an adventure tourist village noted

data.event: It was founded as a goldmining town after a major goldrush in 1867, and is now an adventure tourist village noted for its extensive limestone caves and caving experiences.

event.title: was born in Ireland in about 1826

data.event: He was born in Ireland in about 1826 and as a young man became a sailor, then a gold prospector.
In 1864, Fox travelled to the West Coast.

event.title: discovered it at Fox Creek, a tributary of the Arahura River behind Hokitika, in January 1865

data.event: He prospected widely for gold and first discovered it at Fox Creek, a tributary of the Arahura River behind Hokitika, in January 1865.
According to local historian Les Wright, in July 1866 Fox organised a prospecting voyage to what was later named Fox River but didn't find gold there.
